data.title: Hwa Chong International School: Details, Fees and Reviews
data.meta_description: Hwa Chong International School details and info: Extracurricular activies, are teachers native, class sizes, school bus availability, prices, etc.
data.text:
All applicants are required to complete the following before admission to Hwa Chong International School:

1) Admission to Year 1 to Year 3 – English & Mathematics Test

Admission to Year 4, IBF and IB1 – English, Mathematics & Physics Test

2) A one-to-one interview between a teacher and applicant

Interview will be conducted in English, and will last approximately 15 minutes

The school's programme emphasizes on participation and engagement in activities leading to a more holistic development of the individual. In HCIS, a wide range of activities are offered under four categories: clubs and societies, leadership and interest groups, sports, and performing arts.

Founded in 2005, Hwa Chong International School (HCIS) is a member of the Hwa Chong family of schools. The school's mission is to develop internationalism, innovation and independence in students.

The school currently offers an integrated six-year programme which prepares students for the Cambridge International General Certificate of Secondary Education (IGCSE) at Year 4 and the International Baccalaureate Diploma (IBDP) at Year 6.

Anchoring on Asian values, students of HCIS receive a holistic education where academic achievements are emphasized alongside character development. This is achieved through a diverse range of activities that broaden and enrich students’ learning across cognitive and affective domains. These activities include overseas trips, outdoor activities, student-led initiatives as well as community services. For international students, their learning is also highly enriched with the understanding and appreciation of Singapore’s social, cultural and economic makeup, thereby strengthening their sense of internationalism.
